WorkItem.Description:
[1] In the "Spell Cycles" popup, the last spell cycle(ABFrB3FrBSc) shows 3081 seconds of time.  The fight duration is set as 360 seconds.  (This weirdness continues happens down whenever this negative cost (mp5) cycle is included).
[2] If I right click on an equipped item, edit it, duplicate it, add a new gemming and save -- shortly thereafter I get a exception (Cannot access a disposed object.  Object name: 'ItemButton').
[3] Certain very unlikely items with odd gemming (Amulet of Flowing Life - w/Royal Shadowsong Ameythyst) are sorting to the top of the best items in slot when I click items OR display the comparisons for that slot.
[4] The TPS numbers are whacked -- I'm looking at 2285.06 DPS but 9620.97 TPS !!!

Comments.Message: This is for the mage model with Arcane/Frost mage builds (46/0/15, 48/0/13, etc.)
P.S.> All the odd gemmed items contain the Royal Shadowsong Ameythyst, is this healing/dmg gem being considered pure damage?
To get "negative cost (mp5)" cycles, just include a 300 MP5 Shadow Priest and Mana Spring Totem.
The erroneous threat number are caused by enabling the "Ice Shards" frost talent.
In the optimization checkboxes near the bottom of the options tab, what items are checked? That'll help Kavan track down which model he needs to debug.
Pretty sure this is the bug that Kavan's already fixed, but should wait for Kavan to confirm.
Yea, I'm quite sure it's the same bug. Take another look when 14.1 comes out. If things are still horribly wrong we might be able to squeze 14.2 out I guess.
Do I need to break this out into 4 items?

1 and 4 are the same issue, 2 is noted in other issues, and 3 is being calculated correctly (either you need that color gem to meet your meta requirement, or there simply are no other gemmings of that item).
